title: Stuttering since the anti cheat patch went live
body: Been getting terrible stuttering even though my fps is above 100,feels like 20 fps.

replies.body:
Hi there,

We made a hotfix to address the performance issue y'all are experiencing. Please let me know if everything's OK now.
yup the hotfix seems to have alleviated the problems with stuttering,but ill play a few more games to make sure it has gone away completely,thanks in advance for the communication.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Bugcheck,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=6toPhYMk,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2018-06-15T02:17:46.893+0000)
>
> Hi there,
> 
> We made a hotfix to address the performance issue y'all are experiencing. Please let me know if everything's OK now.

It's not fixed, the stuttering and lower FPS from this patch onwards is still there.

Helped a lot in terms of stability and playability. 
Overall performance is still poor compared to before the patch.
During the duration of my 31 minute game, I had a mostly constant fps of 80 with a few frame drops (still much less frequent than this afternoon).
Prior to the patch I had a constant 120 fps and virtually 0 stutters.

Can confirm FPS is much more stable, there are still little stutters here and there, much much smaller than before, some occur when purchasing items or opening the menu during movement or combat, sometimes while activating skills, I'm not sure if that's tied to the previous issue, but I haven't experienced it before today, however the much larger spikes mentioned in this thread SEEM to be gone, I've only played for around 6 minutes so far and its been much better, hope to see a full fix soon.
still some stutters remain.

This guy described it perfectly, random drops to 70 fps for no reason, freezing, and jittering all the time, says i have 144 most of the time but feels like 40, PLEASE FIX ALL OF MY FRIENDS AND MYSELF CANT EVEN PLA YTHE GAME

Hey there,

Can you please make sure that your graphics drivers are up-to-date and then let me know if the issue persists? We've noticed that drivers that were created a few years ago may have performance issues.

I also have this issue, and I thought I'd weigh in with what seems to be happening.
I run a GTX 1080, and a 5930k, nothing but League opened, every non-crucial service stopped and no extra processes, all temps are normal, GPU and CPU workload is proportionate to what it should be, but the game stutters and chops up, with no detriment to GPU load or otherwise. 

Visually, it SEEMS like V-sync might have broken. FPS isn't consistently locking to refresh rate, all Nvidia control panel settings are correct and match with in-game settings, so I don't think it's V-sync but its exhibiting symptoms that a faulty V-sync would mirror. 

Not an expert, just something i've noticed, hope it gets patched or something soon, it's extremely difficult to play in this environment.
Same problem here. Didn't start happening until this patch.

I have the same problem. All drivers up to date. Didn't have this problem before the patch.

I even tried closing all apps except for league and tried the usual fps fixes.
Can we get more than that?

Framerate is very unstable now and it will randomly skip multiple frames at a time...like 15-20 frames skipped, making it seem like I just lagged for a moment, but I didn't.

I don't think it's the graphics drivers. I think it has something to do with the server. We have entire games lag for about .5 seconds in-game.
I was playing duo with a buddy and we lagged at the exact same time. Same as the enemy team.
I updated my graphics after the games to see if it would help,but it was still stuttering,but it seems like there was a patch when I got home so I will check if that fixed it or not.

Glad to know I'm not the only one. I jumped on and noticed it was jumping around 120 -103. I tried to cap it at like 80 or 60 to see if it would be fine, but then it did the same thing there. It's really jarring to my eyes and throws me off when the frames skip.

Same. Im having massive lag issues now. I can hardly run the game. I also have a really bad computer but I've never had issues with league FPS until now. My fps keeps randomly dropping to 10 or 20 when its usually around 50-60.
SAME. Super annoying like constant skipping
It has stuttered on me a bunch of times today. I didn't realize it was because of a patch. Drivers up-to-date and all that.

Same problem here, I usually had 200+ FPS on high. After I got back from vacation this patch dropped and now my FPS "says" it's 90-140 but it feels like 40-50 with stutters and screen freeze's once in awhile. It's hardly playable. ( I also updated my graphics card, I thought that might have been the issue - but it still has stayed the same)
Me too, never had a problem until today.
